title: It's A Hat-trick! Ranveer Singh Strikes Gold Again As Gully Boy Earns Over Rs 75 Crore And Becomes A Hit!
text:
Apna Time Aagaya!
Well, Ranveer Singh should scream this loudly as he has again achieved a victorious feet. After two massive hits in 2018 including Padmaavat and Simmba, the actor is ruling the box-office yet again!
Helmed by Zoya Akhtar, Gully Boy has lived upto the hype that it created and emerged as a winner at the box-office. In less than a week of its release, Gully Boy has earned about 80 crore, as claimed by a report in Box Office India.
Tiger Baby and Excel Entertainment
The film that released on 14th February earned an estimated Rs 8-9 crore on its first Monday, which is an achievement for a film as it's a day when footfall in movie theaters are expected to take a dip.
Don't Miss 9 K SHARES 1.2 K SHARES 24.3 K SHARES 17 K SHARES
(Also read: From Amruta Subhash, Siddhant Chaturvedi To Vijay Verma: Meet The Real Stars Of Gully Boy)
Tiger Baby and Excel Entertainment
According to trade analyst Taran Adarsh, Gully Boy has also surpassed Zoya Akhtar’s earlier hit Dil Dhadakne Do, also starring Ranveer, on Tuesday.
(Also read: Gully Boy Is Earning Praises! Celebrities Go Gaga Over Alia And Ranveer's 'Finest' Performance)
In his tweet, Adarsh wrote:
Twitter
“#GullyBoy benchmarks... Crossed ₹ 50 cr: Day 3, ₹ 75 cr: Will cross on Day 5 [Mon] Will cross *lifetime biz* of Zoya Akhtar’s #DilDhadakneDo [₹ 76.88 cr] on Day 5 and #ZindagiNaMilegiDobara [₹ 90.27 cr; Zoya’s highest grossing film] in Week 1 itself. India biz.”
Ranveer Achieves A Hatrick!
After roaring success of Simmba and Padmaavat, Gully Boy is his third hit film in a row.
#Simmba crosses ₹ 240 cr... Biz at a glance...
Week 1: ₹ 150.81 cr
Week 2: ₹ 61.62 cr
Week 3: ₹ 20.06 cr
Week 4: ₹ 6.19 cr
Week 5: ₹ 1.20 cr
Weekend 6: ₹ 22 lakhs
Total: ₹ 240.10 cr
India biz.
BLOCKBUSTER. — taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) February 4, 2019
Despite protests and agitations... Despite no release in two states... #Padmaavat survives all odds... Completes 50 days... Crosses ₹ 300 cr... 7th film to swim past ₹ 300 cr mark [NettBOC]... Data and details follow... — taran adarsh (@taran_adarsh) March 16, 2018
description: The film that released on 14th February earned an estimated Rs 8-9 crore on its first Monday, which is an achievement for a film as it's a day when footfall in movie theaters are expected to take a dip. According to trade analyst Taran Adarsh, Gully Boy has also surpassed Zoya Akhtar’s earlier hit Dil Dhadakne Do, also starring Ranveer, on Tuesday.
